intro: Stachys peduncularis, commonly known as purple flowered betony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of violet to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Stachys peduncularis is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
